class="summary">Some UBS shareholders may have concerns closer to home as to what it means for their personal investments now the bank is taking on an institution that repeatedly got itself into trouble. Shareholders of both banks had no say in the mega-merger, which was engineered behind closed doors by the Swiss government, the central bank and the financial regulators.</h2></div><article competitionClients="" currency_ad="1" data-apw="" class="artData clr " data-company-id="11944"><div class="imgBox"><figure class="artImg"><img class="lazy" height="225" width="300" alt="Shareholders chat in front of members of the board (behind) at the end of the last annual general meeting of Credit Suisse bank, in Zurich, on April 4, 2023, following the takeover by UBS of Credit Suisse hastily arranged by the Swiss government on March 19 to prevent a financial meltdown.  (Photo by Fabrice COFFRINI / AFP)" src="https://img.etimg.com/photo/42031747.cms" data-original="https://img.etimg.com/thumb/msid-99256046,width-300,height-225,imgsize-50814,,resizemode-75/shareholders-chat-in-front-of-members-of-the-board-behind-at-the-end-of-the-last-annual-general-meeting-of-credit-suisse-bank-in-zurich-on-april-4-2023-following-the-takeover-by-ubs-of-credit-suisse-hastily-arranged-by-the-swiss-government-on-march-19-to-prevent-a-financial-meltdown-photo-by-fabrice-coffrini-/-afp.jpg"><span class="imgAgency">AFP</span><figcaption class="figCap">Shareholders chat in front of members of the board (behind) at the end of the last annual general meeting of Credit Suisse bank, in Zurich, on April 4, 2023, following the takeover by UBS of Credit Suisse hastily arranged by the Swiss government on March 19 to prevent a financial meltdown.  (Photo by Fabrice COFFRINI / AFP)</figcaption></figure></div><div data-brCount="39" class="artText"><a data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#News#href" href="/topic/ubs" target="_blank">UBS</a> shareholders get their first chance to grill the bank's bosses Wednesday over its shotgun marriage to <a data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#News#href" href="/topic/credit-suisse" target="_blank">Credit Suisse</a>, done in double-quick time behind their backs.<br><br>Switzerland's biggest bank is absorbing its stricken closest domestic rival in a deal stitched together on March 19 out of fears of a global banking crisis if the floundering Credit Suisse went under.<br><br>But some UBS shareholders may have concerns closer to home as to what it means for their personal investments now the bank is taking on an institution that repeatedly got itself into trouble.<br><div class="adBox custom_ad nonm mgid" data-mgid="mgid_99256061"><div class="colombia colombiaAd" data-section="0" data-position="99256061" data-slot="491591" data-msg="ctnCallbackHandler" id="div-clmb-ctn-208630-99256061"></div></div><br>Shareholders of both banks had no say in the mega-merger, which was engineered behind closed doors by the Swiss government, the <a data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#News#href" target="_blank" href="/central-bank-of-india/stocks/companyid-11944.cms">central bank</a> and the financial regulators.<br><br>Wednesday's annual general meeting takes place in Basel, one of the two birthplaces of UBS along with Zurich.<br><br>The <a data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#News#href" href="/topic/agm" target="_blank">AGM</a> is being held in the St. Jakobshalle indoor arena, famously the stomping ground of Swiss tennis great Roger Federer -- Credit Suisse's top brand ambassador.<br><br><div data-size="[[300, 250], [600, 250], [600, 300]]" data-adsSlot="/7176/Economictimes/ET_News/ET_News_InternationalBusiness/ET_ROS_MID_NWS_IBZ_AS_300" data-loc="100" id="div-gpt-ad-858478126-99256061" class="country_specAD"></div>The meeting will see Dutch chief executive Ralph Hamers bow out. Once the AGM is over, Sergio Ermotti returns as CEO, having been called back to UBS to handle the delicate integration process.<br><br><div data-size="[[300, 250], [600, 250], [600, 300]]" data-adsSlot="/7176/Economictimes/ET_News/ET_News_InternationalBusiness/ET_ROS_MID1_NWS_IBZ_AS_300" data-loc="2" id="div-gpt-ad-858478132-99256061" class="country_specAD2nd"></div><div data-size="[[300, 250], [600, 250], [600, 300]]" data-adsSlot="/7176/Economictimes/ET_News/ET_News_InternationalBusiness/ET_ROS_MID1_NWS_IBZ_AS_300" data-loc="5" id="div-gpt-ad-858478132-99256061" class="country_specAD2nd"></div><div data-size="[[300, 250], [600, 250], [600, 300]]" data-adsSlot="/7176/Economictimes/ET_News/ET_News_InternationalBusiness/ET_ROS_MID1_NWS_IBZ_AS_300" data-loc="3" id="div-gpt-ad-858478132-99256061" class="country_specAD2nd"></div>The 62-year-old Swiss banker ran UBS between 2011 and 2020, having been brought in to restructure and stabilise the bank after its state bailout during the 2008 global financial crisis, followed by the 2011 losses of a rogue trader who blew $2.3 billion.<br><br>UBS chairman Colm Kelleher said he felt Ermotti would be the "better pilot" for the bank's new flight path than the digital transformation-focused Hamers, who will stay on for a handover period.<br><br>UBS will become a banking colossus, with $5 trillion of invested assets.<br><br>Kelleher has voiced his concerns about not only the execution risks in carrying out the merger but also about the dangers of "bad culture" from Credit Suisse, primarily in its investment banking, bleeding into UBS.<br><br>There are also the numerous disputes accumulated by Credit Suisse that UBS will have to settle, after having already spent several years settling its own.<br><br>Roger Said, director of the Swiss shareholder organisation Actares, said that Ermotti "will have to put an end to the irresponsible risk culture that has existed for years at Credit Suisse, as well as drastically reduce risky business sectors".<br><br>The annual general meeting comes the day after Credit Suisse held its final AGM before the 167-year-old bank is swallowed up by UBS.<br><br>Credit Suisse chairman <a href="/axel-polymers-ltd/stocks/companyid-8828.cms" data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#News#href" target="_blank">Axel</a> Lehmann said he was "truly sorry" that the national institution could not be saved as he faced angry and tearful shareholders whose money has gone up in smoke.<br><br>He said that "ultimately there were only two options: deal or bankruptcy".<br><br>UBS shares closed up 0.2 percent Tuesday at 18.77 Swiss francs each, while the <a data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#News#href" href="/topic/swiss-stock-exchange" target="_blank">Swiss stock exchange</a> dropped 0.2 percent.<br><br>Credit Suisse shareholders have seen the value of their investment plunge from 12.78 Swiss francs per share in February 2021 to the 0.76 francs they will receive in the $3.25-billion merger.<br><br>The <a href="/ethos-ltd/stocks/companyid-23844.cms" data-ga-onclick="Inarticle articleshow link click#News#href" target="_blank">Ethos</a> foundation, which represents pension funds in Switzerland and owns stakes in both banks, said Credit Suisse shareholders were mobilising to get UBS to think about giving them more than 0.76 francs per share.<br><br>"There are bases being created to potentially go to court to request a review of the exchange ratio," its director Vincent Kaufmann told AFP.<br></div><p style="display:none;" class="footnote-slot showWhatsMsg">Don’t miss out on ET Prime stories! If the visit does take place, it could possibly include a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.</p></div><div class="content"><a target="_blank" data-ga-onclick="3 - href" href="/epaper/delhicapital/2023/apr/06/et-front/uk-govt-offers-to-sweeten-package-for-tata-steel-uk/articleshow/99278455.cms"><img align="left" src="https://img.etimg.com/photo/42031747.cms" class="bigImage lazy" alt="UK Govt Offers to Sweeten Package for Tata Steel UK" height="79" width="105" data-original="https://img.etimg.com/thumb/msid-99278455,width-105,height-79,imglength-13504,quality-100/uk-govt-offers-to-sweeten-package-for-tata-steel-uk.jpg"></a><a target="_blank" data-ga-onclick="3 - href" href="/epaper/delhicapital/2023/apr/06/et-front/uk-govt-offers-to-sweeten-package-for-tata-steel-uk/articleshow/99278455.cms">UK Govt Offers to Sweeten Package for Tata Steel UK</a><p class="line_2"> The UK government has offered to revise the offer made in January to Tata Steel UK, which has been seeking a financial package to execute its decarbonisation plans for the Port Talbot plant. main.headline: UBS shareholders to weigh in on Credit Suisse mega-merger
main.description: Some UBS shareholders may have concerns closer to home as to what it means for their personal investments now the bank is taking on an institution that repeatedly got itself into trouble. Shareholders of both banks had no say in the mega-merger, which was engineered behind closed doors by the Swiss government, the central bank and the financial regulators.
main.articleBody: UBS shareholders get their first chance to grill the bank's bosses Wednesday over its shotgun marriage to Credit Suisse, done in double-quick time behind their backs.Switzerland's biggest bank is absorbing its stricken closest domestic rival in a deal stitched together on March 19 out of fears of a global banking crisis if the floundering Credit Suisse went under.But some UBS shareholders may have concerns closer to home as to what it means for their personal investments now the bank is taking on an institution that repeatedly got itself into trouble.Shareholders of both banks had no say in the mega-merger, which was engineered behind closed doors by the Swiss government, the central bank and the financial regulators.Wednesday's annual general meeting takes place in Basel, one of the two birthplaces of UBS along with Zurich.The AGM is being held in the St. Jakobshalle indoor arena, famously the stomping ground of Swiss tennis great Roger Federer -- Credit Suisse's top brand ambassador.The meeting will see Dutch chief executive Ralph Hamers bow out. Once the AGM is over, Sergio Ermotti returns as CEO, having been called back to UBS to handle the delicate integration process.The 62-year-old Swiss banker ran UBS between 2011 and 2020, having been brought in to restructure and stabilise the bank after its state bailout during the 2008 global financial crisis, followed by the 2011 losses of a rogue trader who blew $2.3 billion.UBS chairman Colm Kelleher said he felt Ermotti would be the  better pilot  for the bank's new flight path than the digital transformation-focused Hamers, who will stay on for a handover period.UBS will become a banking colossus, with $5 trillion of invested assets.Kelleher has voiced his concerns about not only the execution risks in carrying out the merger but also about the dangers of  bad culture  from Credit Suisse, primarily in its investment banking, bleeding into UBS.There are also the numerous disputes accumulated by Credit Suisse that UBS will have to settle, after having already spent several years settling its own.Roger Said, director of the Swiss shareholder organisation Actares, said that Ermotti  will have to put an end to the irresponsible risk culture that has existed for years at Credit Suisse, as well as drastically reduce risky business sectors .The annual general meeting comes the day after Credit Suisse held its final AGM before the 167-year-old bank is swallowed up by UBS.Credit Suisse chairman Axel Lehmann said he was  truly sorry  that the national institution could not be saved as he faced angry and tearful shareholders whose money has gone up in smoke.He said that  ultimately there were only two options: deal or bankruptcy .UBS shares closed up 0.2 percent Tuesday at 18.77 Swiss francs each, while the Swiss stock exchange dropped 0.2 percent.Credit Suisse shareholders have seen the value of their investment plunge from 12.78 Swiss francs per share in February 2021 to the 0.76 francs they will receive in the $3.25-billion merger.The Ethos foundation, which represents pension funds in Switzerland and owns stakes in both banks, said Credit Suisse shareholders were mobilising to get UBS to think about giving them more than 0.76 francs per share. There are bases being created to potentially go to court to request a review of the exchange ratio,  its director Vincent Kaufmann told AFP.

images.caption: Shareholders chat in front of members of the board (behind) at the end of the last annual general meeting of Credit Suisse bank, in Zurich, on April 4, 2023, following the takeover by UBS of Credit Suisse hastily arranged by the Swiss government on March 19 to prevent a financial meltdown.  (Photo by Fabrice COFFRINI / AFP)
